answers.author: John Zakian
answers.text:
In the earlier portion of my public sector career, I worked in a policy role in a city government that in the period of a decade went from a 13 member City Council with 12 wards to a 7 member City Council with 4 districts and three citywide to a 7 member City Council with 6 districts and one citywide...  in hindsight from that experience the changes were far less on the procedural side than on experiencing changes in approach and representation on issues...  One value as in an opportunity to become more effective is streamlining the committee structure... From my experience, the key to answering your question is were the two additional Council Members added citywide or were districts rearranged... the source of representation can definitely have a major impact.
